abstract: Former British Prime Min Tony Blair defends government's decision to issue Irish Republican Army fugitives written promises they will be not be arrested; denies keeping plan secret.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Blair on Tuesday defended his government’s decision to give Irish Republican Army fugitives written assurances that they would not be arrested, and denied keeping the deal secret.
snippet: Mr. Blair on Tuesday defended his government’s decision to give Irish Republican Army fugitives written assurances that they would not be arrested, and denied keeping the deal secret.
